Author: @aepokkvulpex
Comment: Y'know... I've been thinking how it's weird that this conversation doesn't happen around single player games, or story games. But I guess it does, in a different way? Rather than looking at a constantly updating game, you look at the series as a whole. Funny enough, I think Pokemon had the opposite problem. They, too, had no competitor, but every generation they try to "reinvent" themselves with new game systems and mechanics. Frankly, half of the new stuff Pokemon comes up with never lands with the community at all, so I think it's a very bad case of overcorrection in Nintendo's case.

Author: @plushlava
Comment:
I think it's sad that they don't get any recognition for any of the good that their new team and Aaron Keller does. The game has had a steady release schedule for characters and new maps as well as regular, quick, balance updates for the past few years. It seems like the focus is on the blunder that was OW2 debacle, which wasn't the fault of the OW team as a whole, but the fault of Blizzard and, to some extent, Jeff Kaplan not wanting to accept a larger team to work on the game.

Plus, a lot of stuff they're introducing is stuff that took years to develop. Not just reverting stuff. So it's really minimizing the hard work they've put in and the amount of time it took (years) to do it. 

Kinda disappointing to see this take üòí

Author: @M9AX
Comment:
I'm old enough to remember when Overwatch first came out and everyone was like "this is going to kill Team Fortress 2!" when it's just a different game! Marvel Rivals isn't the same as Overwatch, more people are currently playing it because it's new - just like how all the TF2 players went to Overwatch when it first came out because it was the new shiny toy. That's just gaming! When Skyrim first came out everyone put down whatever game they were on (TF2, L4D2, WoW, Minecraft - all of which are still around) to play it. We're gamers! We like games! 

What *actually* makes or breaks a game is how the developers both support it and it's community. Your garden only dies if you don't care for it properly.

Author: @LEVITINx
Comment:
Hey yeatle, been around for a long time but idk if these updates will bring me back. Currently enjoying rivals too much and see little reason to play two hero shooters. A huge factor is that my trust for blizzard is completely eroded. I think these changes came from a financial perspective and while they are good changes, they display that blizzard is still playing it safe in a way. 

Like yes overwatch is changing, but its changing because someone showed blizzard that there's a better way to make these kinda games.

Like... they needed to do this when they added the 2 in the title. Not after a better game came out decades later. The die hards will remain and overwatch might pick up a few new players but i doubt that overwatch will capture that entire mainstream audience again. I dont agree that Overwatch has a fighting chance, I think its a tired old boxer that needs to retire. Im talking Cars 3 the movie.

Not only that, but im not interested in moba/counter strike inspired features like buying builds or perk trees. I dont think perks are the answer, i think their balancing philosophy was the problem. 

Rivals allows everything to feel strong, and gives you strong counterplay options and strong swap options.

I just hate these systems in general because it takes my brain out of the actual gameplay often. I want to focus on perfecting my hero kit, i dont want to focus on a meta perk build for my hero.

Comment:
As far as Blizzard getting the player base trust back, I don't think it can be done. They've burned us on multiple titles and franchises, disrespected us at the infamous BlizzCon Diablo Immortal unveiling, lied to our faces regarding the PVE campaign for OW, and all in all have blatantly shown us that they're after nothing but our wallets. 

Overwatch was the nail in the coffin and Blizzard is on the decline to being a dead company in the next probably 10-15 years. Possibly sooner. Author: @Devlyn444
Comment:
I play the game, I genuinely like the game but I 100% agree somethings need to happen, here are my big 5 things:

1) Scrap the "new" content. Like you said, just revealing "Overwatch" and dropping the "2" would be a massive bonus, on top of reverting back to a 6v6 format. (I do not think Blizzard needs to scrap any hero, except Sombra, if anything)

2) Hero rework. Adapting the heroes so they can fit a 6v6 format, tanks will be hit the hardest.

3) Release more content; heroes, villains, maps, modes, this game needs way more.

4) Scrap FOMO. 
MR: "Do what Marvel Rivals is doing with their Battle Pass system. Oh, you bought it but didn't complete it? That's fine, it's in an archive, you can revisit and unlock things at your own pace."
OW2: "Oh? You bought a Battle Pass but you don't have 20+hrs a week to devote to our game? Welp, better luck next season, lmao."

5) Balancing the fucking roster. Hamster, Hanzo, Sombra, Venture, all of these heroes are so busted that just seeing one is enough to fling a team into a rage. 

5a) Hamster is impossible to kill. I had to coordinate a Junkrat, Pharah, Reinhardt, and a Moira, just so people could kill it.

5b) Hanzo has such a forgiving headshot radius he can shoot score a headshot from a lower level, aiming below your waist, 5 ft to the right of your hip while also doing a double jump right, it's utterly ridiculous. 

5c)Venture is like Mei, able to completely ignore all of your shots by pressing a button, though Venture doesn't heal they do become the most spergy, annoying heroes in the game. 

5d) Lastly, Sombra. I hate invisibility, I hate her ability to teleport out of danger the moment she gets caught, I hate that after teleporting it automatically triggers invisibility, I hate that invisibility lasts 5 seconds and the teleport has a 6 second cooldown, I hate that her Hack ability denies you your cooldowns for 1.5 seconds (or steals a healthpack on the map), I hate that the Hack exposes you to her whole team through walls for 10 seconds, I hate that her Virus ability does something like 80 damage over 4 seconds, I doubly hate that her Virus attack does 120 damage over 2 seconds if you're Hacked, I hate that her Virus has a recharge time of 6 seconds... but most of all, I hate that she can Hack you and then Virus you for 120dmg, mag dump you with her highly accurate, high damage, 60 shot, long range SMG, toss her her teleport to go invisible (all while you're turning around I might add), decloak, toss ANOTHER Virus for 120dmg, then teleport away AGAIN all before your first "Hacked" status is even over. OH! And she can see you through walls when you're low health, AGAIN, so you can literally never get away.

Author: @SpollyTrotts
Comment:
Great comparison, thanks for this. I personally weigh heavily on the fact that marvel rivals seems be a direct rip off of Overwatch in so many aspects. That is something that is very important to me even though it doesn't seem as important to other people.

Overwatch is built on much more polished infrastructure, where as Marval Rivals seems to take the cheaper route in a lot of areas. Whether it be voice acting, some of the animations / particle effects and sub-par coding, balancing, etc.

I don't play either game at this time, and I may be partial as I've played thousands of hours of Overwatch in the past, but I still find it to be a much higher quality game, and most importantly, highly original (but not entirely) in its concept.

Blizzard did poorly manage Overwatch, and that might be an understatement. Overwatch 2 was basically a greedy shop re-work, hardly a sequel. We are yet to see how Marvel Rivals will be managed, and if it will stand the test of time. They do have the benefit of seeing the decisions Blizzard made with Overwatch, what worked and what didn't.

Author: @Dartnitt
Comment: Overwatch animations, facial expressions and effects are top tier. When you watch back replays you see things you dont normally see in the game but devs still added those little details, for example even when junkrat concussion mine hits an enemy, they make proper facial expression and their body like bends a little when they launch into air. Even though destruction in Overwatch is more limited, it still looks a lot better than in Rivals, parts of broken elements stay for longer, it takes more force to break them and they brake more naturally. All that in a game that launched almost 9 years ago. That said, what matters the most is the gameplay and i think overall hero design in MR is a lot better and game offers more characters with unique playstyles, a lot of heroes in Ow were reworked and their unique playstyle got taken away too, like doom, pharah or sombra. So yeah, Ow is a polished game but i think MR wins this one in terms of how fun it is to play, especially in the current state of ow

Author: @TheQuietTimes
Comment:
My only issue with Rivals is the excessive alpha effects. Many times, there is so much visual clutter that it can be near-impossible to tell what's going on, ESPECIALLY if you're playing strategist and are on the back-lines. 

I think particle effects muddying the visibility goes against the entire idea of the flat colors of environments contrasting with the bright colors of heroes and their distinct silhouettes, as team fights tend to turn into "just shoot at the red" (the default enemy outline color) rather than being able to distinguish and focus on a particular target, especially with all the characters bunched up... Which happens way less in Overwatch because it's almost entirely range-based.

Author: @drakath5727
Comment: 9:45 Being someone who played through the entirety of 6v6's dead seasons I absolutely think the game flows better for every role if that 2nd tank exists. The difference is night and day to me - extra mitigation served to balance the supports' broken AoE utility by making it so it had to be timed right to when both tanks' guards were down, and the off tank being able to peel for supports and backline dps took off a bunch of the pressure for them when it came to facing down dive. Hell, a lot of the supports who enjoy being a powerhouse protector in 5v5 can then just make the jump to off tank in 6v6 since its effectively the same playstyle, which means that the roles' queue times will balance out much better.

Author: @eltoons
Comment: I feel like the overwhelming hate and slander around Overwatch is going too far. After literally getting to try the original 6v6 patch of Overwatch, the game has come a long way. As much as I love Overwatch 1, that dev team really wasn't good at balancing, especially compared to the Overwatch 2 team. They've had some misses, but at least they keep reassuring the community that their game is important and that they will work towards creating an experience that satisfies people. The player numbers don‚Äôt lie. I'm impressed that Overwatch isn‚Äôt like Apex right now, which is super dead. I feel like after the Marvel Rivals hype dies down, people will understand and maybe give more appreciation towards the balance in Overwatch 2. I guess I'm just optimistic, but after all the constant low-hanging fruit bashing on Overwatch, it‚Äôs refreshing to remember that it‚Äôs not all bad.

Author: @GuzanGames
Comment:
I like freja as hero, great kit and everything... im more interested in commenting on hero bans and map voting. 

I think both are great ideas is executed well. Hero bans, i really hope they have a safe protection for people always banning X hero due to being OP and this is across multiple games and player base. As this would get annoying and alienate players, and definitely drive people away. Im all for variety and trying different heroes as I do play different heroes myself. The bigger issue would be people overdoing banning the same heroes across multiple games, etc. 

As for the map voting, one reason why I only play more casual especially only playing in QP, is purely because I do see the same maps more chance then none. I barely see runasapi, played it about 3 times.  Hopefully on the flip to my comments on hero bans, they see this as an issue and address this. I literally only play my 3 flex games for the day and thats it, and this is a big reason to why.

Author: @FLXTLINE_M3
Comment:
I want to like Aaron and his team and want to like the new vision for the game. But whenever they make jabs at Overwatch 1 and the original vision for the game; I dislike them more. There's no need to start managing and working on a well-established game that shook ground on release that a CEO abused and trash on it even mildly. You can simply say that the game dev process has been like this but they need a new angle to approach it. 

OW1, old Overwatch was all about risky decisions to make a better game. Characters like Moira and Brig were wild and a lot of people didn't like them at first. Announcing a campaign mode for the new Overwatch was risky but they pushed forward with it despite all the corporate pushback and how they mangled the team further to ensure it didn't happen. So not entirely sure how aggressive and risky decisions for the game are a new philosophy when the worst part of Overwatch's history has been the release of OW2 where they quickly decided to play it safe until competition started beating the shit out of them.

Author: @richardwitt6243
Comment:
___ New Mercy Perk Ideas ___
.
Minor Perk 1:  "Friend or Foe"
Mercy can target enemy heroes with guardian angel.
> Gives some more opportunity to outplay the enemy
.
Minor Perk 2: "Improved Aerodynamics"
Angelic Descent doesnt slow you down anymore.
> This used to be the case during Mercy's first movement rework if i remember correct.
> Enables her to keep more momentum (speed) from GA or enemy boops while gliding.

Major Perk 3: "Highvelocity Impact"
When Mercy's speed is above 10 m/s (horizontal or vertical), her quick melee does increased damage (maybe 75 dmg) and creates a small presure wave that pushes mercy and the target that was hit apart.
> This synergizes with either Perk 1 or Perk 2
> Can be used aggressively or defensively. 
> Gives her the opportunity to deal a bit of damage quickely to maybe fight away a Tracer or Genji.
> Rewards good movement.

Author: @Azarthes
Comment:
I'm sorry, I can't agree with these takes. Perks are all about breaking established conventions of characters. 

It should be the case that picking up a perk makes you rethink your muscle memory around GA, or your function in team fights with chained boosts or heals. If perks only reinforced things your character was already designed to do then the entire concept would be an exercise in futility and they should just buff the character generically.

Author: @PeterDB90
Comment:
"Choose a main" - NOOOOOOOO!
Choose a set of characters to main

Choosing a main will just make you a one-trick pony that, even if you are REALLY good, can be hard countered by counter picks.

Say you REALLY like Genji and only play Genji, what will you do if the opposite team comp is Winston, Symmetra, Mei, Moira, and Brig? You can reflect a couple of things from Mei, one thing from Moira, and ZERO things from Winnie, Sym, and Brig, not to mention your only defense will now be dashing away and you'll just have to play poke until you get blade and even then with that many beams focusing you you'd die even with 2 pocket healers.

Author: @HoboHastur
Comment: Most important tip for new players that you left out is learning and memorizing what us long term players call "the sacred trinity of blame". If you're losing, it's important to shift blame for the loss on your teammates as fast as possible. However the blame only flows in one direction. DPS can only blame Tanks, Supports blame DPS and tanks blame the enemy tank's choice of hero.

Author: @zakthanos6231
Comment:
I loved the original Overwatch in my teens and waited years for the release. There was so much hope and passion. Hearing the interviews from the employees, the dreams of every single person on that team were poured into this IP. When Blizzard scrapped Overwatch 2, they scrapped the project many people had been preparing for their entire lives. Overwatch may have been a marketable PvP model, but Overwatch 2 was going to be the story of hope and making a difference these people had been dying to tell.

The current state of the world may feel like one big bad decision, but the small choices like these are what led us to where we are today. Choosing money over a dream.

Author: @LightingCatxD
Comment: The replay situation leaves me truly scratching my head. Usually the replay system only shows you what the server receives on input, basically the servers pov and not individual players POV‚Äôs at all! Thats why for example if you watch a replay of anyone that is lagging or got switchlagged in a server looks pretty normal besides their inputs themselves lagging around and looking like they got a schizophrenia attack, but no lags themselves will be recorded from the users end-device pov and registered only the received inputs by each player. Not what the user end-device receives. Idk if the same counts for killcams aswell because I noticed while u don‚Äôt see anything the User might see on their enddevice (e.g lags or rubberbands) in their representative killcam, that sometimes killcams look abit different to what the pov would look like in the replay pov. I had some games where a killcam threw me off and when i went into the replay it looked way smoother so welp. This entire thing leaves me quiet with a headscratch bcs this entire video just flipped all the logic and laws that we know of how the servers and replays work over its head. I hope someone deepdives into this thematic and analyses it to its core of how this is possible because I honestly got no explanation for it.

Author: @trainershade1937
Comment:
7:62 
Wait... is that a backtracking cheat? I'm only used to seeing backtracking in Valve games (Team Fortress 2 / Counter Strike), and I've never actually seen it from the cheater's perspective. Backtracking is a cheat that allows the user to see and interact with other players as though they were "in the past" by manipulating server latency (which also means that you're unlikely to see it go back more than 1 second into the "past").

It's really interesting how the replay viewer picks it up, but only when you're using the cheater's perspective. It's also really funny how, due to how fast he's going, it looks like he's teleporting long distances.

Author: @ironman1458
Comment:
This would've been massive like a year ago when people still cared about the game before 90% of the content creators and community jumped ship. Wild how long it took them to do.... literally anything. They gave us nothing for years but now we are supposed to come back and be excited for SEASON SIXTEEN? when dozens of ACTUALLY GOOD GAMES have come out in the MORE THAN TWO YEARS IT TOOK OW2 TO DO LITERALLY ANYTHING to even ATTEMPT to justify the 2. they are so damn out of touch, no wonder rivals took such a shit on this franchise. 

I still remember when all the blizzard shills were spreading the talking point about how pay to win and predatory marvel rivals monetization would be. meanwhile the only reason they thought that is BECAUSE THATS WHAT OVERWATCH 2 DID, THE GAME THEY MAKE A LIVING DEFENDING. this is seriously one of the most pathetic sequels of all time this game deserves to die just based on principle. they spent years ignoring their community suggestions instead putting all the budget into funding shills to gaslight their players, sorry but after fifteen seasons of lies we know better than to trust this company and its unabashed shills. Actiblizz doesn't care they are just pretending to because rivals took a shit on the franchise, and flats is just here to collect a paycheque. The fall off of ow2 is one of the most satisfying and deserved in history

Author: @expertoflizardcorrugation3967
Comment:
for me one thing that's really come to bother me is that these people, especially the women, who we are supposed to believe are experienced and often soldiers, have zero blemishes or scarring. at least most of them.

ffs Junker queen has perfect skin and no scars. half of her character is that she wants nothing more than a scrap. a character I utterly refuse to believe is not on a first name basis with the entire junkertown ER staff rotation, has no visual indicator that she's ever been hurt.

don't get me wrong. characters are allowed to be attractive, but there are types of attractive that can be explored.

also doomfist having no scarring is utterly inexcusable. genuinely I cannot even begin to justify that from a design standpoint.

beyond scarring you have birthmarks, discoloration, or something like vitiligo. so many ways you can break up this tiresome trend of plastic figures that've never left their display case.

I genuinely adore venture, not only because they have a delightful personality, but because their design looks like they lived a life before. they're awkward, they've got a chipped front tooth, their clothing makes me believe that they actually might work with heavy equipment.

Author: @MrWiplazh
Comment:
I don't think the skins are in any way an improvement either. The Overwatch team is likely just a case of Theseus ship where essentially everyone has been replaced, and so the art direction changed with it. Look at Overwatch 1's designs, they're simple, they're not clean, they look like they have history with battle damage and such, and the skins also liked to tell a small story, or at least be simple. OW2 has definitely been declining in terms of art direction especially when you look at those hideous fucking mythic skins, they're prime examples of "overdesigned". 
It's just not very good, even the less extravagant designs look bad, like Venture. There's just no way the art team and art direction of Overwatch 1 is still working on this game, I refuse to believe it.

Author: @eiji862
Comment:
Trying so hard to make 5v5 work, only to fail miserably and finally give in and returning to 6v6. Only they then reverted changes made to characters like Rein making him from the looks of things just not fun to play. 

Remember people, 5v5 was the selling point of Overwatch 2 after they ended up going back on their promise to give us a PvE mode. 

And now they‚Äôve reverted their promise on making 5v5 work. 

So it makes one wonder, why even call it Overwatch 2 at this point? It‚Äôs now literally Overwatch 1 with new characters and a minor graphic patch. Changes that could‚Äôve easily been a seasonal update. 

I‚Äôm done with Overwatch, at least with Marvel Rivals I genuinely have fun. I‚Äôm a bit competitive, but I have a significantly better time in Rivals than I‚Äôve had with Overwatch in a very long time. 

I wish the dev team at Blizzard the best, but I‚Äôm done with their game, Blizzard‚Äôs greed and the dev team‚Äôs incompetence has gone on long enough for me.

Author: @alanbunbun6961
Comment:
I think the 6v6 tank combos are great; it's fun to just DO stuff as a tank without every single button being used on you when you step out of cover.

Rivals is going to have a really tough time trying to figure out how to get more tank players. After the honeymoon and people realize that tanks/supports are a NECESSITY, not an ACCESSORY to the main game loop, they are going to have a very tough time figuring out what is the right path. 

Currently, the only reason I'm playing OW2 is that I feel like the Rivals tanks are a bit bland and don't have as much fluidity as the OW2 tanks. Spilo has a pretty good video on the topic and it's fun to play 6v6, with real synergy and combos instead of raid-bosses.

Author: @khainestar
Comment: Can't help thinking that the perks are a bad idea. One of the things that adds to an overwatch brain, knowing what is going on in a game. Is that you know what you are facing. Rein has charge, firestrike, shield, hammerdown. Or does he now have a charge that shoot fireballs out his ass? Each round you are going to be facing a slightly different Rein, So you need to relearn all the abilities that might or might not be coming towards you, have they picked perk A or perk B, what about the 2nd perk, or third? So there are multiple things that need to be worked out as to what you are facing. Each character will have multiple different things that need to be worked out again. Almost like learning a whole new game. Hello whole new game, whats your name? oh Rivals, well if I am learning a new game anyway. May as well go with one that isn't trying to bleed me dry.

Author: @bastianlopez458
Comment:
Players are not having fun cuz the learning curve is limited. There is no hero learning. What I mean by no hero learning is there is no practice or arcade modes that are designed to teach new players how to play the roles. there's hero mastery but hero mastery doesn't capture the in game scenarios that are needed for new players or even experienced players to refresh on how the characters are played. What are the correct starts that will make your plays better. Also another issue I've had since OW1 and is still an issue as of the current state of the game. Is that while yes there are bot matches that are capture and payload. But there isn't a bot match with flashpoint and clash. That is why bronze and silver players are bad at both modes cuz there aren't opportunities to learn the modes, learn the map layout, what corners are good to catch enemy players off guard, team strats that parties can come together and gather a plan that is beneficial for players in the party needs. New players are being dogged and bashed for not being good at the game, but again there is no opportunity to learn and grow so they are stuck with either two options 

 A. look up a YouTuber who streams and makes overwatch content or look up video guides on how to play their role/character 
And 
B. Learn by getting your ass kicked like a millennial in a halo and cod mw2 360 lobby. 
You could "pay" for coaching to learn how to play the game but who actually has the money and reason to pay for someone else to tell you why you are bad and how you continue to be bad? 
I am all for game studios to pay for professional players to make content and sponsor the game. And I'm all for professional coaching to teach you how to play professionally. 
However there comes a point where it is the game developers responsibility to make sure there is in game content for new players to learn and grow. By again offline practice modes that teach you how to play roles, learn your character with reference scenarios to how a player is meant to be played and the core fundamentals on how the character operates. Sorry for yapping I have a lot on my chest about this game üòÇüòÇ

Author: @whatupguys1
Comment:
I still think the cinematic shorts were a BIG reason overwatch became as big as it was back in 2016. If the overwatch team actually invested some time and effort into the writing and animation of similar content as the cinematic shorts, it would be a huge step into bringing Overwatch back into the eye of the general public. Maybe something like a mini-series of 20 minute episodic stories fleshing out the lore, or just developing new events in the plot (but they have to have the same quality as the cinematic shorts, otherwise people will just turn away after the first 5 minutes). They already had a campaign planned out for the PvE, so there's already a structure to start off from.

If they do it right, this could do what Cyberpunk: Edgerunners did for Cyberpunk 2077 or what The Witcher season 1 did for The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt. It would draw an influx of fresh new players and pull more income to create new content for the game and develop/fix what is already there.

Author: @rinslergj1
Comment:
As someone who is on the side of 5v5 I'll 100% quit if the game switches to 6v6 if I don't quit before then. I do not believe the devs would be able to handle balance in the slightest. I think it would be a year or 2 before all 3 roles feel even remotely bearable to play. Secondly I don't want to play against mauga and orisa or doom and ball. The tank synergy felt great in ow1 cause the characters were made for that. To many changes have happened that tanks will run dominate in 6v6 while dps will become completely unplayable and supps will be playing dead by daylight again. Dps has already lost any identity they had as a role with 80% of the support roster having higher damage outputs along with survivability and dps has some of the least maneuverable characters. 

Blizzard before worrying about 6v6 or 5v5 and any other balance numbers tweaking seriously need to sit down and find the identity they want for each role. Do they want tanks being hyper aggressive bouncing in and out of the enemy backline like doom ball and hazard or do they want tanks providing more of a frontline presence for their and denying key terrain like Winston rein sigma. Give dps some kind of identity not just server adim or punching bags. And have supports be support not a jack of trades that out dps the dps and can frontline longer than half the tanks. 

I personally think characters like doom and ball need to be changed to dps roles. No one enjoys playing with or against them. They are designed to be played solo which is horrible for a tank role. Dps needs to gain an identity of highly maneuverable mechanical skill characters. And support need to lose They're identity of heal or dps being They're only utilities. We need more characters like Lucio who's support identity comes from his speed boost and providing a beneficial utility to his whole team. It's why Juno was so beloved upon release she gave utility to her team and was more than just another i heal or dps like moira bap and illari. Lastly all immortality abilities need to be removed venture mei kiri bap makes it so you feel cheated out of kills and not bested.

Dps massively needs a rework across all heroes and the role in general. Ults are complete garbage and barely feel like you can get a kill with them half the time. Excluding emp, rip tire, or the occasional reaper/genji/ashe ult when do you really care if a dps uses their ult. Name the last time you a panic reaction to a Bastion torb cass soldier hanzo ult the same way you do to an illari ult back on release or a kitsune rush/brig/sigma/jq ult. Ults need to be something that changes the dynamic of the game for a brief time not just oh guess hanzo used dragons let me step 2 feet backwards or oh cass used his ult to reload

Author: @ohm_ow1726
Comment: Totally agree on anything you said before talking about 7v7. All these things've been obvious to some of us original players for years and we've been watching this drama carefully. The notion of streamers running they're own agenda, clickbait content and the community debate lead to the alienation of the process of coming to these exact conclusions. Over 4 years. It's not a shot at the streamers themselves, it's just the conclusion that many of the debates and ideas just missed the bigger picture. 7v7 is not a problem because of visual clutter. You could solve or at least mitigate that problem in various ways. the real question are: how is balance in 7v7 role queue? more fun than unfun (on every role)? Role popularity? Are tanks going to be fun? or are they going to get bullied by 5 other enemy players, their abilities and counterpicks? Tanks are and will ever stay the least popular role. (coming from an og tank player) In any format, it's the same questions.....

Author: @toinouH
Comment:
Clearly the game needs more things to save the game:
- Looking for group
- Tournamenet in game to create player engagement
- Map vote
- Guild/clan with rewards
- Profile insight (was a cool feature)
- 120 tickrate server
- a sort of scrim finder with is between looking for group and custom games

I would also like to see 7v7:
- DPS always said they didn't put enough pressure because of all "countering" ults tanks and healer have. If you add one more dps, you have "less" resources per DPS and there is not any more tank to peel even more so if they want to look for a kill on support it's more easily
- Queuetimes would be solved
BUT:
- even if I agree with you I tend to leave this to a "con" against 7v7: visual clutter
- audio clutter in voice chat at higher elo will be even worse

I know that Spotlight is gonna show hero bans and I don't really like it but that's fine. They mention 6v6 but it won't be the main game mode for at least 3 seasons because of their longterm vision.
If 6v6 comesback some questions will remain:
- will doomfist get a full revert to go to DPS ? A partial revert with mixed old and new kit in tank ? etc
- a experimental card put Mei on tank before and it was kinda great because her wall was harder to break but didn't put that pression of 2 tanks peeling for her which was annoying back then. Imagine now a double wall with Hazard but with a tank peeling mei...
- what do we do with sombra ? (no one knows lol)

Author: @affinity601
Comment:
While i know this was a blanket statement, i cant agree with the league statement on just releasing characters. They nerf and buff the champion pool often but most important, items. They introduce and change them while on overwatch there is no variation of the characters per game. 

Last night i played top vayne. 1 game was witts end for magic resist and attack speed. Game 2 was triforce making me tanky and a good duelist. Game 3 was using arrows making me a squishy killer. Vayne is a bot lane character. I had to change my itemization and each felt different

These items have all been changed or introduced each season. Not to mention having to itemize over an opposite teams items. Then there are objective

When i come back to dogass league, i know i can play different build, learn what new objectives are and try different positions all on 1 character. Overwatch has never has anything like this but its a different game which is why i cant agree there

Author: @Fantas_YT
Comment:
Ngl its a shame the game is dying man. In my childhood around 10-12 yo (now 17yo) i got the chance to play the game at my uncs house and fell in love with it, even tho years later i havent been able to play it cuz paid game i was exited when ow2 came out for free. It was kinda different from what it used to be but still fun but as time passed i just got tired of the same things, tilting every game and stuff.
I did quit like a year ago but still loved the game.
The biggest difference ow1 players will notice is not even the 5v5 mode or the new heroes, it is the difference of what the game wants, it used to be a game that provided fun to people rather than just a game to just earn money lose its value and leave it there, i do get the fact that they need the money to continue the game but they made us dirty making everything behind a pay wall.
Theres a lot of other ways to be able to make profit from the game and keep the players playing.
Theres a big reason of why League is the most popular game for like a decade their constant updates, new content, lore etc. Ofc its stupid to ask for often updates from a fps game and balancing could be difficult, nonetheless i new content and new lore or even just random animations would bring back a lot of people, overwatch animations are probably the best ive ever seen, even if they are short 1-2 minute videos they really attract people, league Arcane is a big example, not only bringing big profits but also new players to the game.
Now winning games doesnt reward you anything but elo and a title for a season, why not just give some chest for the mvps, even if its just some emotes players would be grateful and keen on continue playing. The chest removal was also a big issue in the game, you can check league now, they removed the chest because of ‚Äòlow‚Äô profit which is dumb making f2p players leave the game and big hate from the community.
Theres genuinely a lots of things ow could do to  rescue the game
